alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 2:07PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Eagle and Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 PM MST, Conditions are favorable for ice jams. - There is an increased risk of ice jam release along the Roaring Fork River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carbondale, Basalt, Snowmass and El Jebel.
info.instruction: Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.
